programs.title: Tours of Cathays Park Campus (in English)
programs.description:
Why not take a walking tour around the Cathays Park Campus with one of our student guides? There will be plenty of time to ask questions and it’s the ideal way to find out more about the academic and social facilities in different areas of the campus. Each tour lasts approximately 45 minutes. 

Please note that we are also offering tours of the Cathays Park Campus in Welsh at 10.00am and 1.00pm.
programs.description_short: A student-guided 45 minute walking tour around the campus.
programs.room: Horseshoe Drive, front of Main Building

location.title: Main Building (Park Place)
location.description:
Main Building - Architect W.D. Caroe sought to combine the charm and elegance of his former college (Trinity College, Cambridge) with the picturesque balance of many of the University of Oxford colleges. Building work on the Main Building commenced in 1905 and was completed in many stages, the first in 1909. Money ran short for this project, however, and although the side-wings were completed in the 1960s the planned Great Hall has never been built.

Water refill locations: 

Ground Floor  
- Room 0.91 North corridor 

1st Floor 
- Room 1.75 next to the male toilets
- Opposite Council Chamber near Library
- Inside the cafe

programs.title: University Chaplaincies - Anglican and Methodist Chaplaincy
programs.description: The Chaplaincy Team currently has Christian (Anglican, Eastern Christian, Methodist and Roman Catholic), Jewish, Hindu and Muslim chaplains. Regardless of your faith background, we are here for all our students. Chaplaincy staff and current students will be available to answer questions about faith communities, student societies and university life in general. We can also provide information about opportunities for students to engage socially and to explore faith and spirituality whilst at University.
programs.description_short: Information about opportunities for students to engage socially and to explore faith and spirituality whilst at University.

programs.title: Postgrad Café
programs.description:
Join us at our Postgrad Café to find out more about postgraduate funding opportunities for September 2019.

At the Postgrad Café, you’ll be able to ask questions and discuss your options over coffee with the Postgraduate Team and some of our current students. however, there won’t be any academic staff in attendance at the event. The event will also include a funding talk to provide you with further information.
programs.description_short: Join us at our Postgrad Café to find out more about postgraduate funding opportunities for September 2019.

programs.title: Cardiff Films... (in English) with Free Popcorn!
programs.description:
If you would like to find out more about the University, our student residences and the city, don’t just take our word for it - come and enjoy free popcorn and watch our student-led films being shown throughout the day:
• Cardiff University Residences (4 mins)
• Cardiff: The City (1 min)
• Sport at Cardiff University (1 min)
• A Student Tour (1 min)
• Cardiff: One of the top 10 most beautiful universities in the UK (1 min)
• Student Life at Cardiff University (3 mins)
• Global Opportunities (2 mins)
• Centre for Student Life (2 mins)
programs.description_short: Find out more about the university through some short films.
programs.room: Film Marquee, Car Park, Main Building

programs.title: Widening Participation Drop-in Session
programs.description:
We offer support to a wide range of under-represented groups in Higher Education prior to applying to university, including:  
- Asylum Seekers
- Looked after Children and Care Leavers
- Estranged Students
- Forces Veterans
- Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Trans(gender)
- Mature Students
- Student Carers
- Student Parents

If you fall under one of these categories please feel free to drop in and meet with the Widening Participation Team, we can provide:
- Individual pathway planning to help you make important decisions about university
- Tailored advice on making the most out of an Open Day
- Support and advice on the process of applying to university
programs.description_short: Drop-in support for students from under-represented groups.

location.title: Hadyn Ellis Building
location.description:
The Hadyn Ellis building is named in honour of the late University Deputy Vice-Chancellor, Professor Hadyn Ellis. The ground floor includes an attractive public area for lectures, displays and conferences about the University’s work and a 150-person lecture theatre. The building has been recognised for its sustainability and was awarded the Higher Education category of the Building Research Establishment Environmental Assessment Method BREEAM) Awards Wales in 2012.

programs.title: Moving from School to University: Adapting to University Life
programs.description: Moving away for the first time and making the transition from school to university can be an exciting yet, perhaps, slighting daunting prospect. So why not come along to our session to find out more about some of the fantastic support opportunities available at Cardiff University to help our students settle in, feel at home and really get the most out of university life?
programs.description_short: Find out about two new University-wide initiatives which aim to foster a supportive environment to help you to succeed and enjoy your time at university.

location.title: Main Building (Park Place)
location.description:
Main Building - Architect W.D. Caroe sought to combine the charm and elegance of his former college (Trinity College, Cambridge) with the picturesque balance of many of the University of Oxford colleges. Building work on the Main Building commenced in 1905 and was completed in many stages, the first in 1909. Money ran short for this project, however, and although the side-wings were completed in the 1960s the planned Great Hall has never been built.

Water refill locations: 

Ground Floor  
- Room 0.91 North corridor 

1st Floor 
- Room 1.75 next to the male toilets
- Opposite Council Chamber near Library
- Inside the cafe

programs.title: Languages for All, Welsh for All and Global Opportunities
programs.description:
● Whether continuing a language or learning a new one from scratch, our flexible Languages for All and Welsh for All schemes offer the opportunity to develop your language skills alongside your degree, for free!
● Interested in studying, working or volunteering abroad whilst you are a Cardiff student? Our Global Opportunities Team will talk you through the wide range of opportunities available, as well as exploring the benefits of international experience.
programs.description_short: Find out more about the extra-curricular languages and travelling opportunities available while studying at Cardiff University.

programs.title: City Tours
programs.description: If you are new to the city of Cardiff, why not take a coach tour of the city centre and its sights?  You will see Cardiff’s magnificent civic buildings (of which the University is a key part), Cardiff Castle, the iconic Principality Stadium and Cardiff Bay. Each tour lasts approximately 50 minutes. Please note, demand tends to be busier in the afternoon.
programs.description_short: A 50min bus tour of the city.
programs.room: Coaches depart from the front of Main Building, Museum Avenue

programs.title: Cardiff University Students’ Union Meet and Greet
programs.description: Our Students’ Union is rated one of the top 4 in the UK, according to the Times Higher Education Student Experience Survey 2018. As a student-led, independent part of the University, it offers an exciting programme of entertainment, diverse clubs and societies and a comprehensive range of welfare, advice and information services - all key aspects of student life within a purpose-built complex. Why not come and meet some of our current students at the Welcome Centre on the second floor of the Students’ Union? They will be happy to answer any questions.
programs.description_short: Meet our current students to answer your questions about the students' union and student life.

programs.title: Sports Facilities - Cardiff University Sport Fitness and Conditioning Centre - Senghennydd Road
programs.description: Located at the heart of the main campus, this facility offers three floors of cardio, resistance and weights equipment. The fitness suite houses a broad range of resistance based equipment and cardiovascular machines, with a state of the art strength and conditioning provision on the top floor. Used by international rugby squads in preparation for fixtures against Wales, the Centre is suitable for all abilities from beginners through to professional athletes.
programs.description_short: View our Fitness and Conditioning Centre on Senghennydd Road
programs.room: Fitness and Conditioning Centre, Senghennydd Road

location.title: Fitness & Conditioning Centre
location.description: The fitness suite not only houses a wide range of resistance based equipment but also a range of cardiovascular exercise equipment with audio visual capability and internet connectivity. We have 3 glass backed squash courts which have hosted many events including the Welsh Junior Open.

programs.title: Sports Facilities - Cardiff University Sport - Sports Training Village Talybont
programs.description:
Conveniently located at one of our major student residences, you’ll find a wide range of indoor & outdoor sports facilities. Our multipurpose sports halls accommodate training and matches for many of the university sports clubs, with a fitness suite, conditioning room, glass back squash courts and cricket nets also available here. Outdoor facilities include floodlit artificial pitches and tennis courts. The Centre also hosts physiotherapy services and team conditioning sessions.

*Buses for Talybont depart from the front of Main Building, on Museum Avenue. Please note, the last bus will leave Main Building at 3.00pm and Talybont at 4.30pm. (Time to allow for using shuttle bus: approximately 1 hour, including viewing.)
programs.description_short: View our Sports Training Village at Talybont.
programs.room: Sports Centre Reception, Talybont Sports Training Village

programs.title: Student Residences - Talybont Court
programs.description:
Students who make Cardiff University their ‘firm’ choice university will be guaranteed accommodation in their first year. Settling in and making new friends are important first steps in university life. With 16 different residences providing in excess of 5,500 study bedrooms, Cardiff students can apply for the residences which best suit their particular preferences and, unusually for a civic university, the residences are within walking distance of the main campus and city centre. The following sample residences are open to view today: Talybont Court
(£131 per week based on 2019/2020 costs)
• Self-catered, en-suite
• 15 minutes walk from Main Building
• Shuttle bus available on Open Day. The communal area of an accessible flat is available to view by request only. Please speak to a member of staff at the residence for further details.
programs.description_short: View the University residences at Talybont Court. Note, last entry will be at 15.45. The last bus to leave Main Building (Museum Avenue) is at 15.00 and the last bus from Talybont is at 16:30.
programs.room: Buses depart from the front of Main Building, Museum Avenue

location.title: Talybont Court
location.description: Talybont Court is part of the Talybont complex which is the largest of the University’s residences and provides a range of social amenities including excellent sports facilities. This purpose-built development is situated close to large areas of parkland and is a short walk or cycle to most of the academic buildings.

location.title: Senghennydd Hall
location.description: Senghennydd Hall is a part catered residence situated within a very short distance of the Cathays Park campus and ideal for students studying Mathematics, Physics and Astronomy, Engineering or Computer Science. The evening meal service provides students with a hot meal Monday to Friday except during vacations. Generally the meals are served between 5.00pm – 7.00pm at the nearby Trevithick Restaurant in the Queen’s Buildings.

location.title: Bute Building
location.description:
This Grade II listed neoclassical building was designed by architects Percy Thomas and Ivor Jones, who won a competition in 1911 to design a building for Cardiff Technical College. The foundations of the building were laid in 1913 and the building opened in 1916. The building has six Roman Doric columns in the front of the building and includes the Birt Acres Lecture Theatre.

The foundations of the building were laid in 1913 and the building opened in 1916. The building has six Roman Doric columns in the front of the building and includes the Birt Acres Lecture Theatre.

location.title: Main Building (Park Place)
location.description:
Main Building - Architect W.D. Caroe sought to combine the charm and elegance of his former college (Trinity College, Cambridge) with the picturesque balance of many of the University of Oxford colleges. Building work on the Main Building commenced in 1905 and was completed in many stages, the first in 1909. Money ran short for this project, however, and although the side-wings were completed in the 1960s the planned Great Hall has never been built.

Water refill locations:

- Room 0.91 North corridor 

1st Floor

- Opposite Council Chamber near Library

programs.title: National Software Academy in Newport
programs.description:
Come and experience our new and unique environment. Drop-in to talk with staff and students about how we collaborate with industry and teach the BSc Applied Software Engineering course with real projects to boost your employability prospects. 

An ambassador will guide visitors to the National Software Academy’s new building in Newport at 12.45pm from the Help Desk in Room C/2.11, Central Queen’s Building. (Please note that a shuttle bus service to the Trevithick and Queen’s Buildings will depart Main Building car park at 12.30pm.) Pre-paid, return train tickets to Newport will be provided. We will return to Cardiff at approx. 2.30pm-3.00pm. For those travelling by car, the nearest parking for the National Software Academy is NCP, Newport High St, Newport, NP20 4AX, or NCP, Newport Station Approach, St Lukes, Bridge Street, Newport, NP20 4AT. Please note, parking charges apply.
programs.description_short: Drop in to see our unique environment and learn more about our collaborations with industry
programs.room: National Software Academy,Information Station, Old Station Building, Queensway, Newport, NP20 4AX

location.title: Main Building (Park Place)
location.description:
Main Building - Architect W.D. Caroe sought to combine the charm and elegance of his former college (Trinity College, Cambridge) with the picturesque balance of many of the University of Oxford colleges. Building work on the Main Building commenced in 1905 and was completed in many stages, the first in 1909. Money ran short for this project, however, and although the side-wings were completed in the 1960s the planned Great Hall has never been built.

Water refill locations:

- Room 0.91 North corridor 

1st Floor 
- Room 1.75 next to the male toilets
- Opposite Council Chamber near Library
- Inside the cafe

topics.name: Journalism, Media and Culture
topics.description:
3rd in the Guardian's University league tables 2020 for Journalism and Public Relations. 

The School of Journalism, Media and Culture is located opposite Cardiff Central Train Station and is approximately 20-30 minutes on foot from the Cathays Park Campus. Alternatively, a shuttle bus will leave Main Building (Museum Avenue) at 10.50am, 12.50pm and 1.50pm to take visitors to the School. A return shuttle bus to Main Building will depart from the School at 11.10am, 12.10pm, 1.10pm, 2.10pm and 3.10pm. If you are travelling by train, you may wish to plan your day in advance and consider visiting the School on arrival at Cardiff Central, or on your return to the station.

Please note, the last bus to leave Main Building will be at 3.00pm and the last bus to return from the Heath Park Campus will leave at 4.30pm. The Heath Park Shuttle Bus will stop at Talybont Residences on its return journey from the Heath Park Campus to Main Building.

location.title: Music Building
location.description: As you approach the School of Music, you can’t fail to notice the bronze sculpture on the lawn outside. We often get asked about this artwork so here’s a little background on it. The piece is called Three Obliques (Walk-In) and was created by the famed artist Dame Barbara Hepworth in 1968. Only two others exist, one at Chatsworth House, and one in Seattle. It’s an astonishing piece of sculpture and provides a lovely backdrop for our annual graduation photos!
